marketNews.title: New Finance Minister Promises to Keep APBN Deficit Under 3% of GDP and Ease Liquidity
marketNews.content: Finance Minister Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa assured that his ministry will keep the state budget deficit below 3% of GDP and emphasized that there is no need to impose new taxes, aligning with the stance of his predecessor Sri Mulyani. Purbaya also said that the government plans to inject about IDR 200 trillion of cash reserves held at Bank Indonesia into the banking system to improve liquidity and stimulate credit distribution, which is expected to create jobs. In a joint meeting with the House of Representatives on Wednesday (10/9), Purbaya noted that tight liquidity had caused Indonesia's economy to slow down over the past year. He highlighted that slow government spending had led to an increase in the government's cash reserve at Bank Indonesia to IDR 430 trillion. Purbaya stated that the liquidity injection plan had been discussed with senior Bank Indonesia deputies so that the funds would not be re-absorbed by the central bank but instead be utilized by commercial banks. The statement came amid foreign investor concerns about fiscal discipline after President Prabowo Subianto replaced Sri Mulyani as finance minister. Sri Mulyani had been seen as a symbol of fiscal credibility during the last three administrations, according to Bloomberg. Purbaya said he would not take unconventional steps and would focus on accelerating government programs and improving liquidity to boost economic growth without increasing the government's debt burden. Previously, Purbaya claimed that Indonesia's economy could grow above 6% year-on-year in the near term and could potentially reach the President's target of 8% year-on-year growth. The 2025 APBN outlook projects economic growth of 4.7-5% year-on-year, while the 2026 RAPBN targets 5.4% year-on-year growth.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: The new finance minister's commitment to keep the APBN deficit in check was received positively by the market, with the Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) rising 0.92% on the day, Wednesday (10/9). The gain was led by the Financials sector (+1.33%), driven by higher prices of big-bank stocks, likely also influenced by the positive sentiment from the government's liquidity-easing plan, a key issue for the banking sector. As an illustration, the Loan-to-Deposit (LDR) ratios for the big four banks as of June 2025 (excluding BMRI for May 2025) are: BMRI 93.1%, BBNI 86.2%, BBRI 85%, and BBCA 78%.

marketNews.title: Other Hot News
marketNews.content: 1. The Israeli military said on Tuesday (9/9) that it had carried out an attack on a senior Hamas leader in Doha, Qatar. Qatar's foreign ministry strongly condemned the attack, calling it a violation of international law. 2. The U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) projected that Brent crude oil prices could fall from $68 per barrel in August 2025 to $59 per barrel on average in Q4 2025 and around $50 per barrel in early 2026, driven by large oil inventories as OPEC+ production increases. 3. U.S. President Donald Trump told EU officials he is willing to impose new tariffs on India and China to pressure Russia to end the war in Ukraine, but Bloomberg reported that Trump would only act if EU countries also impose similar tariffs. 5. China's National Bureau of Statistics reported that China's consumer price index (CPI) fell 0.4% year-on-year in August 2025, below the consensus expectation of a 0.2% decline. Monthly, the CPI was unchanged (0.0% month-on-month) versus an expected 0.1% rise. Core inflation was 0.9% year-on-year, and producer prices fell 2.9% year-on-year.

tickerNews.title: MAPI Acquisition Approved by Philippine Competition Commission
tickerNews.content: The Philippine Competition Commission has approved the acquisition of shares of Mitra Adiperkasa (MAPI) by Pacific Universal Investments Pte. Ltd. from PT Satya Mulia Gema Gemilang. The transaction details are not disclosed on the IDX, so the deal value is unknown. Pacific Universal Investments is a Singapore-registered holding company incorporated in 2022, with no further information on its owners. The commission approved the deal because the parties involved, including MAPI’s Philippine subsidiaries MAP Active Philippines, Inc. and Planet Sports, Inc., do not reduce competition in the Philippine retail sector. PT Satya Mulia Gema Gemilang holds 51% of MAPI.

tickerNews.title: PANI Announces Reasonable Acquisition Price for CBDK Shares
tickerNews.content: Company Secretary of Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua, Christy Grassela, said in a public expose on Tuesday (9/9) that the fair price, verified by a public appraisal firm, for the purchase of up to 44.1% of Bangun Kosambi Sukses (CBDK) shares is IDR 6,450 per share. This price aligns with Stockbit's estimate. Previously, PANI announced a rights issue for up to 1.21 billion new shares, assuming potential proceeds of IDR 16.73 trillion, but the execution price has not been disclosed.

tickerNews.title: BBTN Raises 2025 Credit Growth Target to 7-9% YoY
tickerNews.content: Bank Tabungan Negara (BBTN) revised its 2025 credit growth target from a range of 7-8% YoY to approximately 7-9% YoY, supported by an increase in subsidised mortgage loan (KPR) quotas under the Housing Financing Liquidity Facility (FLPP) program and government housing policy support. BBTN's President Director, Nixon L. P. Napitupulu, said that raising the FLPP KPR quota from 220,000 units to 350,000 units in 2025 will provide additional capacity for the bank to disburse subsidised mortgages.

tickerNews.title: SMRA Reduces Capital Contribution to SMIP by IDR 300 Billion
tickerNews.content: Summarecon Agung (SMRA) announced that it has reduced its capital contribution to its subsidiary PT Summarecon Investment Property (SMIP) by IDR 300 billion on 4 September 2025. Previously, SMRA made an in-kind capital contribution to SMIP of IDR 8 trillion in June 2024. According to the 2024 financial report, SMIP changed its status from a publicly listed company to a closed-share company because it has not conducted an initial public offering.

tickerNews.title: MEDC Revises 2025 Oil Production Target to 155-160 mboepd
tickerNews.content: Medco Energi Internasional (MEDC) revised its 2025 oil and gas production target to approximately 155-160 thousand barrels of oil equivalent per day (mboepd), up from the original target of 145-150 mboepd. The revision follows MEDC's acquisition of Fortuna International (Barbados) Inc., which increased MEDC's participation in the PSC Corridor block from 46% to 70%. The additional participation adds about 10 mboepd to MEDC's production and raises proven plus probable reserves by 63 million barrels of oil equivalent (mmboe) to 184 mmboe. Assuming mid-cycle oil prices, the asset could contribute an additional USD 145 million of EBITDA in 2026.

tickerNews.title: NS Private Equity Trust IV Acquires ~140.7 Million PACK Shares
tickerNews.content: NS Private Equity Trust IV purchased approximately 140.7 million shares of PT Abadi Nusantara Hijau Investama (PACK) at an average price of IDR 228 per share on 8 September 2025. The transaction value was about IDR 32.1 billion and is intended for long-term investment. After the transaction, NS Private Equity Trust IV's ownership in PACK increased from zero to roughly 8.81%.

tickerNews.title: BTPS Announces Potential Dividend Payout Up to 60% of Net Profit
tickerNews.content: Bank BTPN Syariah (BTPS) announced that it may distribute a dividend payout ratio of up to 60% of net profit for fiscal year 2025, compared with 25% in 2024 and 50% in 2023. The final decision will consider other corporate actions such as share buybacks. BTPS had previously prepared IDR 927 billion for a share buyback program scheduled from 11 June to 9 September 2025, but the buyback was cancelled as the share price continued to rise. The bank remains optimistic about achieving double-digit net profit growth in 2025, after posting a 17% year-on-year increase in the first half of 2025.

tickerNews.title: GGRM Clarifies No Mass Layoffs
tickerNews.content: Gudang Garam (GGRM) clarified to the IDX that the company has not carried out mass layoffs, contrary to media reports. The company explained that it has released 309 employees through normal pension processes, voluntary early retirement, and the expiration of employment contracts in accordance with regulations.

tickerNews.title: BBCA Purchases 66,000 Shares at Average Price of IDR 7,575
tickerNews.content: The President Director of Bank Central Asia (BBCA), Jahja Setiaatmadja, bought 66,000 BBCA shares at an average price of IDR 7,575 per share on 9 September 2025. The transaction value was approximately IDR 500 million. After the purchase, Jahja's direct ownership in BBCA remained roughly 0.03%, showing no significant change.

tickerNews.title: DATA Targets 5 Million Homepass in 2 Years and 25 Million in 10 Years
tickerNews.content: Remala Abadi (DATA) President Director Agus Setiono said the company aims to have 5 million homepass within the next two years and 25 million homepass within ten years. Currently, DATA has 350,000 homepass and 80,000 active users as of August 2025. DATA also plans to acquire an internet service provider this year to reach 500,000 homepass by the end of 2025.

tickerNews.title: PGEO Announces Groundbreaking of Pilot Green Hydrogen Plant in Lampung
tickerNews.content: Pertamina Geothermal Energy (PGEO) announced the groundbreaking of a pilot green hydrogen plant in Ulubelu, Lampung on 9 September 2025. The project is scheduled to start operations in 2026 with an investment of about USD 3 million. The produced hydrogen will be used for market testing, including applications in the transportation and industrial sectors.

tickerNews.title: BUVA Plans Rights Issue of Approximately 4 Billion New Shares
tickerNews.content: Bukit Uluwatu Villa (BUVA) plans to conduct a rights issue of about 4 billion new shares at an execution price of IDR 150 per share, with a ratio of 225:44 and an expected dilution of 16.36%. The execution price is 56% lower than BUVA's share price on Wednesday (10/9). The rights issue could raise roughly IDR 604 billion, of which IDR 175 billion will be used to acquire a 55% stake in PT Bukit Permai Properti from PT Summarecon Bali Indah and PT Bali Indah Development, while the remainder will fund hotel business development in Pecatu, Bali. PT Nusantara Utama Investama will act as a standby buyer, and other shareholders, including Hapsoro, will transfer their rights to PT Nusantara Utama Investama. After the rights issue, PT Nusantara Utama Investama's ownership in BUVA could increase from 67.02% to 72.41%. The rights issue trading period is from 31 October to 6 November 2025.
